summary.value: 15+ years coding in Spring + Hibernate with Oracle / PostgreSQL; 5+ years of performance testing with Neoload / JMeter; passing / working experience in LAMP, jQuery and Bootstrap/CCS3; 1+ years of experience in React.

description.value: React + Typescript frontend development and Java backend microservice development for TripAdvisor as part of a staff augmentation contract with Encora

Albet SA was the commercial front for the software products of the University of Informatics Sciences. During this time I worked on several projects, mainly developing an ERP for the Venezuelan CICPC.
CS Teacher, (CS 101 to basic compiler programming); also worked as an undergraduate thesis adviser and academic researcher for competitive programming and pedagogical methodology investigations.
Freelance development of C# apps with Microsoft Kinect; development / support of small advertising web apps for SECOM - GMIXON - PIXELIRIS.
Performance testing for a microservice architecture for K12 Inc, an US based education content provider. This includes large E2E performance tests, as well as smaller focused tests for REST APIs.
internal development of auxiliary web tools for data management and lower environment handling for K12

Graduated with honors. Stayed after graduation to work as CS instructor / teacher. undergraduate work included software development on college projects for external clients and developer / organizer for programming contests, activities and trainings

Worked on the Caribbean Online Judge, a software evaluation tool for competitive programming which was the first of its kind in Cuba and the Caribbean. Over the years this work evolved and ultimately allowed the creation of the ACM ICPC Caribbean Region.

Introductory course to Oracle basics and PL/SQL queries. Imparted in Venezuela in 2010 by Enfoque Directo Aplicado (E.D.A), a partner of Oracle University. Required for database management and complemented by a second, uncertified module on Oracle replication.
NIST in this context refers to ANSI/NIST-ITL 1-2000, a data format for the exchange of fingerprints used by Sagem SA, the training entity

entries.name: Advanced training course on MSO SDK

description.value: MSO SDK is the device API for SAGEM Morpho fingerprint scanners, programmable from C# and Visual Basic.NET
